reviewTitle: Reliable and Affordable Microphone for Karaoke and More
reviewDescription: **Singing Machine Wired Microphone for Karaoke (Black)****Reliable and Affordable Microphone for Karaoke and More**I recently used the Singing Machine Wired Microphone in black for a karaoke night, and it proved to be a solid performer that met all my expectations. This unidirectional dynamic vocal microphone is a great option for anyone looking for a straightforward, no-fuss microphone for singing, public speaking, or parties.**What I Liked:**- **Clear Sound Quality**: The microphone delivers clear and crisp audio, making it ideal for karaoke sessions. The unidirectional design helps focus on the vocals while minimizing background noise, which is especially useful in a lively party environment. Whether used with a karaoke machine, amplifier, or speaker, the sound quality was consistently good.- **Durable Build**: The microphone feels sturdy and well-made, with a durable plastic and metal construction that can handle the wear and tear of regular use. Despite its affordable price, it doesn’t feel flimsy, and I’m confident it will last through many karaoke nights and events.- **Plug-and-Play Simplicity**: The microphone is incredibly easy to use—just plug it into the compatible device, and you’re ready to go. There’s no need for complicated setups or additional software, making it perfect for quick and spontaneous use. This simplicity is a huge plus, especially for those who want to get started right away without any technical hurdles.- **Comfortable Grip**: The microphone is lightweight and comfortable to hold, even during extended use. The design is ergonomic, so it feels natural in hand, which is important when performing or speaking for long periods. It’s easy to pass around at a party without worrying about anyone dropping it or finding it uncomfortable.- **Versatile Usage**: While I primarily used it for karaoke, this microphone is also great for public speaking, announcements, and other events where clear audio is essential. Its versatility makes it a useful tool to have on hand for a variety of occasions.**What I Didn’t Like:**- **Basic Features**: The microphone is very straightforward, with no additional features like an on/off switch or volume control. While this simplicity makes it easy to use, some might miss having these controls, especially in a louder environment where you might want to quickly adjust settings without touching the connected equipment.- **Standard Length Cable**: The included cable is of standard length, which worked fine for most of my uses, but it could be limiting if you need more mobility or are performing on a larger stage. If you need more range, you might need to invest in an extension cable.- **No Shock Mount or Stand**: The microphone doesn’t come with a shock mount or stand, which would have been nice additions for those who want to reduce handling noise or set the mic on a stand for more professional use. However, for casual use, this isn’t a major drawback.**Bottom Line:**The Singing Machine Wired Microphone in black is a reliable and affordable choice for anyone in need of a microphone for karaoke, public speaking, or parties. Its clear sound quality, durable build, and plug-and-play simplicity make it an excellent option for casual users and those looking to add a dependable microphone to their setup. While it lacks some advanced features and accessories, these are minor considerations compared to the overall value and performance. If you’re looking for a straightforward, no-nonsense microphone that gets the job done, this one is definitely worth considering. It added a lot of fun to our karaoke night, and I’m very happy with its performance!

reviewDescription: This mic works with my JBL party box 310 portable speaker. I tried a 3.5mm headphone adapter on this and the mic would not work. Luckily, the mic port on the speaker I am using has the larger jack for the signal receiver that comes with this mic.Mic signal was working at 30 ft through almost 12” of drywall. Not sure how far the signal will go without anything blocking it.Definitely impressed for the price. Might need a specific type of adapter to make this work on a 3.5mm jack.

Update 5-24-14:  I wanted to add an additional update here, I found out that the system has enough microphone gain if the signal sources are configured properly.  The best way to use the machine and get enough loudness out of the microphones is to turn down the music source (iPod, iPhone, iPad, etc.) and then turn up the overall system gain.  This makes the microphones louder relative to the music and it works perfectly.  I changed to 5 stars for the review as well.I bought this microphone as an accessory to the Memorex Karaoke station so that both of the kids would have one to sing into.  The build quality is stable and it sounds good, easy to use.  I am not sure how well it will do over the longer term if it gets dropped a few times but works well to start.

reviewDescription: I was looking for a replacement microphone for my singing machine karaoke system and this didn’t work with it. Very light, not very durable and didn’t work in anything I tried using it with.

This was my first order on Amazon.  I was happy that the microphone arrived on time, and the packaging was fine (so this is where one extra star comes from).However, I was extremely disappointed in the product itself.  I sing and play multiple instruments, so I wanted to make clearer recordings than my laptop itself would allow; I am also taking a class next school semester that requires voice recordings (just speaking).  I plugged the microphone into 4 different laptops, a karaoke machine, a piano keyboard, amplifier, etc. (basically anything that the adaptor and the microphone w/out the adaptor could be plugged into), but the microphone didn't work at all.  I did go through the steps of fixing/changing the settings on the laptops to test the sound of the microphone; the only time there was any indication of sound going through the microphone was when I hit the microphone, and I had to hit it on the top with a lot of force.  This was not worth my time or money.The one extra star also comes from the refund that I got immediately after sending my complaint in about the product.  Thankfully, service was good and, better yet, I did not have to return the microphone, which saved me from having to pay extra shipping fees.

reviewTitle: Save your money and buy a rechargeable wireless mics.
reviewDescription: The sound of the mic is good but has problems that makes it impractical. First issue is you can't use two of these because it uses the same channel. There is no option to switch so either use the wired mic or get a different brand wireless mic. Second issue is the battery. It lasted about 6 hours before I needed to replace the reciever. The third issue is the build. It feels very cheap because its made out of plastic. Last issue is the value. There are other mics on Amazon that are rechargeable, last longer, have better build, and have multiple channels. I recommend the wireless usb-c rechargeable Lekato mic. One receiver supports 2 mics so you technically buy 2 sets and use 4 mics.

reviewTitle: Decent Little Mic for the Price
reviewDescription: There's some distortion and feedback (more so than with the microphone that came with the Karaoke machine). But for the price, it's not a bad little mic.

This is the second one of these microphones that I've bought. I picked up one (same brand/model) last month at one of the local big box stores and it worked well enough that we wanted another one. We're not using them with a Singing Machine karaoke system, but rather a Pyle Home PT270AIU 300-Watt Stereo Receiver, which has two microphone inputs and allows you to sing/talk over whatever is playing. The two mics work reasonably well - given the system we're using them with. And considering these microphones themselves are pretty budget priced compared to professional grade equipment. Still, they are more than adequate since we're just playing around at home.I like that the cords are ten feet long, that means we don't have to use extension cords. One thing that I might note, these mics are unidirectional, but you really need to hold the microphone close to your mouth and (this is important) sing/talk directly into the top of the microphone. The design of the mic inside the head is such that sounds coming into the sides doesn't reach the microphone (I unscrewed the head off one and discovered that).All-in-all, these are decent enough given what they are selling for. I'm happy with my purchase.

reviewDescription: The 1/4 inch jack is a nice feature because you can easily plug it into a lot of professional equipment without having to use an adapter.

I decided to rig up a karaoke system using some karaoke software and an old pc, but of course i needed microphones. Most importantly, these look right- this is what you want to be holding when you are singing. They sound good enough for karaoke use, but only when i ran them through a USB mic adapter. When i was running them through a mic/line in port, the volume was very low and it was very hard to balance it with the music. That's why I'm docking them one star. On the other hand, most computers would only have 1 mic port anyway, so if you want to sing with a partner you're better off getting a pair of cheap, identical, usb to mic adapters. The build quality was pretty decent and very important, they come with a 3.5mm adapter so you can connect them to most computer equipment as it uses that TRS size (its native 1/4 inch or 6.5mm). So if you want to sing karaoke at home, buy a pair of these and if you're looking to hook them up to a PC don't forget 2 cheap usb sound adapters. They're definitely worth the investment.

The only thing is the design makes it hard to put the batteries in the microphone itself and it must be screwed on just right or it wont stay shut. Otherwise I love it!!

reviewTitle: I fgeel like I should wear a white glove accessroized with rhinestones, when I use this.
reviewDescription: My voice sounds like an anthem of cherubs and angels singing "Ave Maria" when I speak into this microphone. I feel like Andrea Botticelli when I use this microphone.  :::pinches fingers in Italian:::

reviewTitle: Also disappointed in the flimsiness of the switch- which doesn't always ...
reviewDescription: Seems to cut out some. I can see the other complaints about the flimsy cap on the bottom of the microphone- it is a little bit of a challenge to get the cap screwed on right and have the battery seated well. Also disappointed in the flimsiness of the switch- which doesn't always turn off completely (and that would be a problem with rapidly draining battery). Mostly connects and works well, but it isn't always perfect and doesn't seem as loud working with the Singing Machine as the wired microphone. Still, it is good to not have little girls tripping over wires and pulling machine off the counter!
The piece that connects to the speaker is pretty fragile and cheaply made so be diligent with it. Other than that, mic works great. Good product for the price.

This is the 2nd one I buy.  Generally they work pretty good on a cheap Karaoke machine.  Good sound.  They both however have a defective screw on bottom for the 9 volt battery compartment to the microphone.  Others have complained about on reviews also.  It doesn't stay on, gets loose and cross threads and pops off.  Plan to Tape the bottom of the Microphone to prevent the problem.  If it weren't for that I would have given it a 5 star.  You also can only use one at a time on a dual microphone input machine.  Two of these together on the same machine interfere with each other.

reviewTitle: I ORDERED THIS MICROPHONE TO REPLACE ONE THAT I HAD ...
reviewDescription: I ORDERED THIS MICROPHONE TO REPLACE ONE THAT I HAD LOST. I MUST ADMIT, I DID NOT OPEN THE BOX FOR ABOUT 3 WEEKS BECAUSE I WAS ON VACATION AND HAD FORGOTTEN ABOUT IT. WHEN MY 11 YEAR GRANDAUGHTER CAME OVER LAST WEEK, SHE OPENED THE BOX AND WITHIN 2 HOURS THE MICROPHONE DIDNT WORK. WHEN WE UNSCREWED THE TOP, THERE WERE WIRES THAT WERE BROKEN. I AM HIGHLY DISAPOINTED RIGHT NOW. UNFORTUNATELY, I THREW THE BOX AWAY WITH ALL PAPERWORK INSIDE. WISH I COULD GET A REPLACEMENT BUT I DOUBT THEY WILL DO IT WITHOUT THE PAPERWORK.
Por el momento muy bueno

Only use this for the Singing Machine. Great Amazon customer service, ended up returning.

reviewTitle: I would just say that it broke many times and if I were you, get a better quality microphone.

Then I couldn't use it. I just think that it was kinda a pain to keep buying it a lot so I would recommend to get a more high quality microphone for karaoke.

Beware to all. Gave the two that we bought to the kids. Next look at them found they had black all over their mouth area. Then dried - inside & out before screwing back on. This seems to take care of the problem. As they were in sealed packaging, it was a shock. Otherwise, they work as expected. The mic cord is long enough. The sound is super low. If you are trying to get your voice heard this is not the best mic.

reviewTitle: ... bought many of these and at first they were great. They would work for a solid karaoke night
reviewDescription: I have bought many of these and at first they were great. They would work for a solid karaoke night. But inevitably they would break, one by one. The problem is a design flaw that creates stress on the ground wire solder point. Sometimes even just the smallest amount of pulling on the cord that is attached to the base of the mic will create tension and pull that soldered wire free. You will then unscrew the top and sure enough, the circuit would be broke. I think I had bought about 4 of these over the course of about 2 - 4 months and I even resoldered a couple of them, which gave me a few more nights worth of use out of them. But them I found a different option on Amazon that added about 4 dollars to the price but over a year worth of work. As such, I really cannot recommend these at all.
The product description says that it comes with an adapter for 3.5mm, but upon opening the package, the adapter is not included. If your setup requires a 3.5mm plug, consider another microphone.

reviewTitle: DO NOT BUY - short life, low sound quality, short range for a wireless, static
reviewDescription: We got the microphone and right out of the box the first one was defective - the battery would not fit into the slot of the microphone base at all and it would not screw together.  This product requires a 9 volt for the microphone and another 9 volt for the jack/wireless sending unit.  After contacting the company was able to get a replacement.  The new mic worked but it had static and a short range for wireless - not much longer than the corded unit.  It also does NOT fit into the microphone holder on the machine which is mind boggling since it is a singing maching mic!  It only worked for a couple times.  We don't use our machine very often so we just got it out and put fresh new batteries in it and the mic won't work at all - I think we only used it 2 or 3 times.  I will not be buying another one.  I'll go back to the wired mic that fits into the holder, has a much better sound and lasts longer than just a few plays.  How disappointing.

reviewTitle: Poor quality in the wire -- wire will break or is broken upon wire.
reviewDescription: Giving one star because microphone arrived DOA.  The internal wire is broken at where it connects into the microphone and resulted in high amounts of popping and static when flexing the wire just one inch from the microphone.  The wire has to be bent just the right way (which is difficult when holding on to the microphone) to permit it to conduct the signal.  The build of the microphone is sold, with a large sliding on/off button.  I would have given it 5 stars, but the broken wire ruined the experience.  The microphone's packaging caused the wire to be bent at an 80 degree angle, which probably contributed to the weakened wire and ultimate failure of the entire microphone.I would expect this kind of failure after regular usage, but not right out of the clam-shell packaging.

I was so excited to try it but turns out it has to be 4 AAA batteries. This page is misleading. I hope you fix this. This really put me off.

I can only imagine that turning the cover against the fixed battery position put pressure on the innards of the microphone causing it to snap. Not Cool!

reviewDescription: In this case, you get what you pay for. When plugged in, this microphone doesn't have that rich tone when you hear it through the speaker. There are also static issues when the mic is in motion. But if all you want is something to fill a basic need at your karaoke party, this is OK. The cord is a good length, though.

The price for this is craZy. Sound was too low comparing other products also the attachment that goes into speaker needs batteries and it drains too quick. I used it for 30mntes and batteries was drained  Would not recommend.

reviewTitle: Requires two 9V batteries. Lots of static when in "standby".
reviewDescription: Be warned that this device requires two 9-V batteries to work with a "classic" model of "The Singing Machine". The static from the mic and the constant humming of the "Singing Machine" drive me insane, but do not at all bother my 11 year old daughter who LOVES this microphone. She hasn't yet used it for Karaoke, but rather enjoys providing narration for everything going on in the home. Had I know how much she would love it, I would have spent more on a higher quality mic that would work with a higher quality speaker system. "Ladies and Gentleman, my mom is now going to walk across the room! Yes, ladies and gentlemen, there she goes! Mom, do you have any comments for the audience?" LOL.
I bought this 2 weeks before my daughters baby shower, and the day I needed it, it hardly would work..i was very disappointed that it could not be used for what i needed it for.

reviewTitle: Worked Right Up Until It Didn't
reviewDescription: No one in my family can really sing. We carry a tune well enough to make a song recognizable, so karaoke is cheap at-home entertainment for us. And it makes for consistent fun at parties. So when the wireless microphone that came with our original Singing Machine system seemed a bit spotty, I bought this one. The original wired microphone had been just fine, so it would seem this one would be, too. No dice. It was okay at first, but it died a year later. It wasn't dropped (to my knowledge). It merely stopped working. For the price, I guess it's not that great an investment to undertake yearly, but what a pain. I won't purchase this now that I need to replace this one, too.

the first few times it worked fine; but I stopped using it for a year b/c I was away. When I used this microphone again for the first time in a year, it no longer worked. all of my 4 laptops recognize it as a speaker and microphone function doesn't work. I tried googling and finding help videos to stop from my laptops recognizing it as speaker but it didn't work. The first time i bought this thing, i remember all of my laptops recognized it as microphone no problem so i started using it as soon as i plugged it in.

reviewTitle: Did not like this for sound
reviewDescription: This may be fine for a child’s little karaoke machine.. but it really does not work well.. you have to speak into one little area of the Mic to get any projection

reviewTitle: Doesn't come with a 3.5 mm adapter
reviewDescription: I really had no opportunity to try this product, but I'm giving 2 stars because it doesn't come with the 3.5mm adapter which is necessary for the kid's version of the "singing machine karaoke" The wired version (same brand) comes with the adapter so I thought it would be cook to have the wireless one....but it didn't even if it is advertised like that. Buying a separate adapter will be $10 so I might as well return it.

reviewTitle: Great sound quality, until it broke
reviewDescription: The sound quality was great. It does require multiple batteries in the antenna and microphone which can gondead quickly if you don't remember to turn them both off after each use. My biggest problem is that the antenna is not strongly made and protrudes awkwardly from the input jack. A simple bump will knock it away from the jack and the inner wiring easily rips out. So after less than 1 month, it's broken and useless.

reviewTitle: You need to scream into it to make it work.
reviewDescription: This is worth exactly what you pay for. You need to have this thing like down your throat to actually hear sound in the speaker. I tried even changing the speaker to no avail, still have to cover your hand near the top of the mic head to have your sound waves carry into the mic. Would def not buy again.

Bought two and they broke within the first week. We do also have 5 kids... and needed to use the adapter it came with to fit our machine. The adapters are what broke, they are very flimsy and the weight of the cord is just too much for them. Returned both
Should be ok, still using the first one

reviewTitle: It does work, but it's CHEEEEEP! Throw-away expensive toy
reviewDescription: The system is a good one, but the craftsmanship is bogus. This product is made to break and fall apart. If you can't afford to waste the money, then don't buy it. The battery compartment on the mic doesn't fit well at all, and will probably break soon (see other reviews), and the switch on the receiver is garbage. It is broken, right out of the box, but it does work. The range is good at least to 50 feet, and the frequency pickup is heavy on the bass, good for crooning. Weak signal, needs boost and heavy EQ to make palatable sound. Easy to overload.
Great design and sound reproduction.Light weight.Down side, En. batteries drained about 3 hrs. into the singing. Luckily I bought a large pack.
I love the machine but the microphone could have been better. It doesn’t pick up your voice well. It’sa poor quality. The machine itself is perfect.

reviewTitle: Great for exercising a 3 year old that loves to sing...
reviewDescription: Bought this for my 3 year old who, I think, is planning on being the next pop star.  He loves it, the batteries last a good long time and there's no cord to get tangled up or rip the plug out when he gets too far away from the karaoke machine.  Volume is good, sound is good...does exactly what we all hoped it would do - wear out a 3 year old bopping around singing and dancing to songs.Would definitely buy again!

Not bad for the money. The sound quality is decent enough but the range is pretty poor, getting crackly at around 6 ft with the receiving antenna fully extended.It did do what I wanted it for which was to test the waters. I will be upgrading shortly and this will be relegated to backup only. If you know for sure you want a wireless mic, I would skip this one and find something else but if you're just messing around or need something short-term, this may fit the bill.
Wonderful
I like cheap and work good

Bought as an add on second microphone for the Karaoke Singing Machine.  Works well. Not a professional microphone.  Does overmodulate if too loud.  Works fine for it's purpose.  Sturdy design and well made. Plastic.  Would Recommend as a second mic for Duets!  4 Stars.
Great for duets but after a couple of uses it’s hard to hear .. sounds like it’s not on when using it
It was really hard to hear anything from this. It may have been our kid- piano we hooked it to.
This is a good mic ...

This microphone is worthless. I tried to use it using a JBL partybox speaker with a dedicated microphone input (lest anyone might think that my results were due to a junky speaker). When I turned up the gain high enough so that my voice could be heard coming through the speaker, there was a VERY noticeable fuzz sound. I don't get this with the cheap wired microphone that I also have.

Very disappointed. The microphone package was cut on the bottom and you could tell someone had replaced it because the cord isn't even rolled up well. I was going to wrap the package from delivery but so thankful I did not and decided to double check. My children would've had to witness this on Christmas day...

This thing slowly stopped working after less than a month of use.  At first it sometimes worked, if you kind of shook it around it might start working for a while.  Finally stopped working all together.  I unscrewed the top and the connections had become unsoldered.  Would like to return this but it is past the return window.  I will probably attempt to solder it back on, but I really shouldn't have to.  The microphone that came packaged with the karaoke machine has been fine so far.

reviewTitle: Little to no sound at max volume
reviewDescription: Although it came quickly I am very disappointed. I plugged it in for my daughter as soon as we got it so she could use it on her Singing Machine she just got for Christmas (bought a second mic so her sister or friends could sing with her) and you can barely hear it! You have to put your mouth on the mic and put it to max volume to even hear it a little. Would not recommend this item.

reviewTitle: Defective  microphone and wrapping package for that microphone...
reviewDescription: I asked for 2 microphones.  One was returned apparently  by someone else before in 2017... according to the tag. Unbelievable.. it was open , all tapped in a hurry and pieces loose inside...I  didn't  bother to open the other one ... please people... I am paying for a new one ..  not a used one....

Even with the amplifier on max volume, this mic has issues picking up and amplifying sound. In addition to that, the on/off switch turns off under its own weight, so you have to hold it in place for it to work. Overall not something I would recommend if you are looking for a microphone, as I would often be louder myself than the microphone and the amplifier.
This mic volume doesn’t go as loud as the speaker if that makes sense. You practically have you yell into it and have your lips touch the mic so your voice can be heard on the speaker.

So I plugged it into my daughter's mic outlet on her keyboard.  It only works if your mouth is pressed into the mic with your hands covering it.  That's really gross considering the mics going to be covered in spit.  Worst mic ever.  Not even loud.

reviewTitle: Micrófono inalámbrico con exelente sonido pero exagerada menté sensitivo
reviewDescription: No tengo mucho que desir masque es un producto casi profesional con exelente receptor de sonido pero las naves y partes exteriores del micrófono esta mui uecas que captan asta el tallon de las llemas de los dedos con el plástico

I got this home and when I plugged it into my guitar amp I didn't even know it was working. On max volume I couldn't even hear myself. I tried it on my JBL speaker and then it was even worse. This microphone it very cheap and gives off little to no sound even if you talk directly into it. I would not recommend.

turned lips black :( and yes, i know you're not supposed to kiss the thing, but let's be honest, these are kids here and it takes some getting used to! Definitely creeped out the kids when they realized they had been covered in a strange black film from the mic. functions ok otherwise, but cord is long and bulky which i hadn't considered

reviewTitle: Love the sound! But very cheap
reviewDescription: Love the sound and the wire is long. Don't like that the wire is in built, so, if it get damage, adios micro!UPDATE: After a 1.5 years of very low use, the micro is not working anymore.

Bought this for our daughter to hook up to our surround sound system to sing. The quality is cheaper than I expected but it works. The major negative is that it is not loud. We have to max our system out to hear the voice which is only a little louder than  a speaking voice. It is not the system as other microphones have only used half the volume.
Does not make a clear crisp recording.

reviewTitle: Si me gusto pero poca durabilidad
reviewDescription: Si me gusto pero poco tiempo de vida

I bought this as a second mike for the Memorex MKS-SS2 Singstand 2 I bought for my 7 and 9 yr old boys for Christmas.It didn't work as well as the mike that comes with the stand, but it was ok. I bought it so I could possibly avoid a fight over the microphone, but now they fight over who gets the "better" microphone.

reviewTitle: Well made, sturdy, doesn't pick up voice that well.
reviewDescription: It works well enough for a karaoke machine, but really doesn't pick up the sound of your voice unless your mouth is right up on the thing. But for a simple singing machine, I guess it's okay, it's well built though, with a sturdy construction, better than the ones that come with the singing machines. I just wish it picked up your voiec better

It's okay, but there's a cheaper one that is better.  I purchased 2 at the same time, this one for $20 and this one " Audio-Technica ATR-1100 Unidirectional Dynamic Vocal/Instrument Microphone" for $8 something- the cheap one works the best.  We're using these for kids and the cheap one picks up sound the best.  Would recommend that one over this one.

reviewTitle: I don’t want to share this product to anyone.
reviewDescription: I couldn’t wait my product but when it’s came I was so  disappointed you have to stay close to the Bluetooth system but they say 90 feet it’s not true
Good for the price but connection cuts in and out quite a bit.

reviewTitle: I was not specifically expecting the best sound quality
reviewDescription: I bought those mic to practice at home and get accustomed to holding a mic while performing.I was not specifically expecting the best sound quality. But this does not even produce decent sound. The voice levels fluctuate intermittently. I did some research online, and found that some mics have to be held at a certain angle to your mouth to get the best input into the mic. I tried all angles and combinations but was not able to get this to work.Sad part is, I did not get a chance to use the product until about 2 months after purchase. But when I did, I was disappointed.
Used it for one night and it stopped working. The adapter just wouldn’t turn on. Opened it to switch batteries and still doesn’t work. Bought it for thanksgiving.

reviewTitle: Not working right straight out of the package
reviewDescription: We just got this delivered. Kids were really excited to sing together, we immediately opened it and it is not working right straight out of the package. You have to hold the on button (that you slide up and down) up for any noise to come through. I’ve tried everything I can think of to get it to work without doing this (it is hard for a small child to continually hold the button up while singing). So disappointed with this product!

I bought this mic to connect to my Yamaha AVR for Karaoke . But even for full sound volume in AVR the sound is very low . A normal volume level you can’t even hear any thing . Not useful for the purpose I bought so had to return it .

reviewTitle: Worst Service response- They simply said that our product is fine
reviewDescription: Model #: Singing Machine SMM-205The microphone is not loud at all from the day I purchased. I have to keep mouth inside the microphone still it is not working. I know I would have a complaint on day one but still, I am annoyed at how the microphone is catching the voice. It’s same like with or without a microphone. Same voice not working. Can you please replace with a better product. I can pay to upgrade as well but this is a waste of my money I spent on your product.

Didn't work straight out of the package; LED lit up on mic but not on receiver.  Contacted Singing Machine, they wanted me to verify with the manufacturer of my audio equipment that the mic would be compatible.  Audio equipment is the, and the manufacturer said as long as the mic is outputting an analog signal, it should be compatible.  Singing Machine confirmed that the mic outputs an analog signal, so the product must be defective.  Got a replacement from Amazon, same issue.  No idea if it's the microphone or the cooler/stereo causing the issue (as I've had numerous issues with it as well).  All I can say is buyer beware.
This mic only worked twice then it quit working all together.

reviewTitle: Just go with half price wired mic!
reviewDescription: This does not even work with all the speakers the mic is not the greatest when it works either! Just get 10 buck wired mic!
Cannot get microphone to work.

I choose this product based on prior reviews of the Singing Machine which I also purchased.  People noted that it was a good idea to also purchase this wireless microphone to go along with the karaoke machine.  Unfortunately, this microphone did not work...the sound coming out of the microphone was barely auditable.  So I am returning and hopefully a replacement will work properly.  We did carefully read all instructions and decided to return and try again with another of the same microphone.  My granddaughter was very disappointed as she could not play with this wireless mic over the Christmas holiday.

reviewTitle: Do not order if you just need a wireless microphone.
reviewDescription: I need a microphone for my classroom. This is what this microphone was labeled. It’s not until it’s opened and you read the directions that you discover that you have to have a certain karaoke machine (don’t need one of those) for it to work. So now I have an opened microphone that won’t work for my purposes.
We bought this for our outdoor wedding and it didn't turn on.
It didn’t say that I needed a karaoke machine, I wasted my money.

It came with a different plug in and different packaging from the reviews. Unfortunately I don’t have any pictures, but in short, it wouldn’t plug into my amp, it was too small. However I will say that I was able to return it and get a refund so I’m still happy, but I wouldn’t buy from them again.

reviewTitle: This is a simple device that arrived dead
reviewDescription: I needed this item for a party in two days.  It is a simple microphone that came with no instructions.  None should be needed.  Plugged it into an amplifier and NOTHING.  It did not work at all.  A simple, non-destructive test at the manufacturer should have caught this item.  Amazon is sending me a replacement, but not in time for the event.
The listing says it requires double A batteries but that’s wrong. I bought double a batteries along with this mic and I can’t use them as it requires triple a batteries. Please fix this.

Cockroach Warning! I purchased this mic as an addition to a karaoke machine for Christmas.  We used it now and then, total of ten times... Then it stopped working. We removed the mic cover and a dead cockroach fell out, also the tape that wraps around the mic had a multitude of what appears to be baby cockroachs.  I have never been so horrified. Thank God these bugs were locked into the top of this or I would have a different problem all together. My children are so freaked out, and I am disgusted. My fear is where the hell this mic was made and that there are bugs making thier way into the equipment as its being constructed. I worry about everything I purchase now because there is no way for me to know what we purchase isn't bringing something like this into my home. Horrified and Disgusted.
Doesn’t amplify sound unless your lips are touching the microphone.
I received the incorrect color and missing adapter

reviewTitle: Looks and feels great - NEVER judge a book by it's cover!
reviewDescription: We were looking for a low-cost microphone to add to our karaoke machine and, based on the good reviews on here, went ahead and purchased one.  It was well-packaged and came with convenient adapters.  Physically, it felt well-built and sturdy.  This mic worked fine at first, and sounded decent for the price.  Over a few weeks, it started working intermittently and also introduced lots of hum into the machine.  Then the switch started malfunctioning to the point where you had to hold pressure on it to keep the mic on.  It was too late to return the item, so we bought another one thinking it was just a fluke.  The new one worked out of the package, but after 1/2 hour of singing, it started doing the same thing, and eventually stopped working altogether.  Two chances is all this manufacturer gets.  I would not recommend this mic to anyone.

reviewTitle: Good for the price, compatible with the singing machine Disco light karaoke machine.
reviewDescription: We purchased the singing machine Karaoke machine for Christmas, the included microphone went bad the first day of use, it seemed to be cheaply made. I purchased 2 of these to replace it (the karaoke machine has 2 mic inputs for duets). Our kids have used this now for the last few weeks. and the microphone have held up well. They are better quality then the original, not the best out there but for this price, they are an excellent replacement.

Does the job and its a great value. You just have to be careful with angle and distance. The mic has to be straight and fairly close to work properly. not  a huge problem but you have to maintain awareness
Grandson loves

Got this as an addition to our daughter's new Singing Machine.  It works perfectly, just don't get extremely close to the machine.  It used 2 9V batteries, one in the receiver and one in the microphone.  The only con we have found is that it does not in the microphone holders on the side of the Singing Machine.  Other than that it does the work and allows you to be cable free.

I read the other reviews and wouldn't have bout this except that everything else like this is in a different price range entirely. There is a little noise when no one is talking, but it does the job for a kids kareoke machine. Before this we had microphone tangles and even pulled the kareoke off the table a few times. Too bad you can't use two at once, but it still helps to only have 1 with a cord. Also doesn't eat batteries.
It’s is lightweight and must have batteries to use. It has a little static at times when in use and not in use.

We bought a karaoke machine for our daughter and her family Christmas 2014 and they love it and still use it with 2 sons now 10 & 13 years old and 15 yr old daughter. I just bought a 2nd one for our 5 teenage foster girls and they had it put together and singing in about 20 minutes.  I bought this product as a 2nd microphones with each machine purchased.

Works great as a second microphone for our karaoke machine.  The sound is fine...nothing great.  If you are super into singing, then you may want to find something a little more higher quality.  But for my children, this microphone works perfectly.  The cord is nice and long so they can move around and dance while singing.  It also looks different than the other one we have, so they know who had which one.
So far so good it works well
Good

This product came on time and the packaging was good, however it has a short, You have to push up on the power button for sound to come in. Didn't feel like going to post office and doing a return for a simple mic so we make it work
Its ok

The first one I received of these did not work at all.  We plugged it in and got nothing.  Amazon was very cooperative and immediately sent me another one.  So far so good but it has only been a week.  I guess we shall see
It was okay. So-so.Not very clear in my opinion, and the on-off switch is very VERY cheap.Great for kids. I wouldn't use it professionally in any way.
It is very average. It worked for a few months but now it's broken and we cannot use it anymore. We did not overuse it though... hence the disappointment
Color

reviewTitle: Spend a few more dollars and get a better mic.
reviewDescription: It works but I have to turn up channel volume and master sound on my mixer, and aux volume and master volume on the system. Spend a few more dollars and get a better mic.

reviewTitle: This Microphone is a good microphone, besides the fact that you literally have ...
reviewDescription: This Microphone is a good microphone, besides the fact that you literally have to talk directly into the top of the microphone. If you try to sing into the sides, you won't be able to hear anything, which is pretty annoying.

reviewTitle: La caja de la batería es muy pequeña
reviewDescription: La batería entró muy forzosa

While I like the product and it's set up was super easy, the speakers are pretty quiet. Probably appropriate for my 11 year old, but way to quiet for my adult friends. Was hoping for more power - should have looked at amp output first I guess.
It does it’s job it’s what you expect form and an expensive microphone it’s not professional but it works just fine.

I bought this for my granddaughter and she loves it. She hooks up to my amplifier and sings into it. You do have to turn it up to hear her sing and you have to put your mouth up to it also. Other than that she enjoys a lot. Great price for the product.

reviewTitle: It was great once I got an amplifier to plug it into
reviewDescription: I bought this because I thought I could just plug it into the TV for our Karaoke night but it does not work that way.  I had to buy a Karaoke machine and I used this as a second mic.  It was great once I got an amplifier to plug it into.

reviewDescription: I wish it had better quality sound... maybe if I hook it up to surround sound or sometning... it sounds tin  nie  like its brassy or something  not really quality sound .  I will try it hooked up to surround sound that may help  not real happy ith the quality sound.

reviewTitle: Decent enough for kids Karaoke machine
reviewDescription: Bought so that we could have an additional mic for our three kids to sing together with their new memorex karaoke machine. Not a huge fan that you have to sing directly down into the top of it to be heard, but it's also not a $200 mic. Does what it needs to do...entertain my kids!
Works good over my sound system.
Great value for the money. Would buy again.
Works but you have to get you mouth extremely close to mic for sound to be picked up..Satisfied for the price.

Bought as a Christmas present for my 4 year old. She LOVES IT.  Great sound and does the trick for her.  Only downside would be that it is not wireless, but we knew that when we bought it.  It works for our needs.
Great for the price. The only down is you have to get very very close to the mic.

reviewTitle: Stopped working in less than 2 months of intermittent mild use
reviewDescription: Feels fairly sturdy and sounded good while it worked but one mic stopped working in less than 2 months of mild use. 30 day return policy. Boo. I understand the concept of "you get what you pay for" but still... Not sure what I could have done to prevent it from breaking besides never using it.
Can barely hear it.
sounds low not very load for this mic.

reviewDescription: The computer came promptly but when I needed tech Suport. It was a week before someone called me back. the CD ROM was not rewritable and there is a plate missing . all in all it is a good computer. I had to replace the CD ROM and add more ram. Not very happy.
Terrible sound quality

reviewDescription: You cannot use more than one at least Mike's they're always on the same frequency the only make one frequency so you can only use one Bluetooth mic the other has to be a chord
This product did not work the jack fit but kept coming out. Very disappointed.
Volume is so low i can't even say its value for its money.
It only works with mic in your face. Other than that -  no volume. Sucks.
